intro: Phyllanthus tsarongensis, commonly known as the Tsarong's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are alternate and often have a glossy surface, while the flowers are small and clustered in cyathia. The species is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
